doc.title: Great Generals of the Ancient World: Julius Caesar
doc.plot: Julius Caesar has to be considered one of the most central figures in Roman history. Rapid promotions from a humble civil servant put him in command of the mighty Roman Legions which completed the conquests of Gaul and Britian, and established him as a great but bloodthirsty general. However, the politically ambitious Caesar made many enemies and was finally assassinated in the Senate House on 15th March 44 B.C.
